image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Missouri; born in New York City December 6, 1873; moved to Hopkins, Nodaway County, Mo., in 1881; attended the common schools; studied law; was admitted to the bar in 1898; afterward attended the Kansas City Law School in 1898 and 1899 and commenced the practice of law in Kansas City, Mo., in 1899; associate city counselor in 1909; first assistant prosecuting attorney 1910-1912; mayor of Kansas City 1912-1916; lecturer on criminal law at Kansas City School of Law 1917-1936; elected as a Democrat to the Sixty-eighth Congress (March 4, 1923-March 3, 1925); was not a candidate for renomination in 1924; resumed law practice in Kansas City, Mo., where he died July 13, 1950; interment in Mount Moriali Cemetery, near Kansas City, Mo.

researchRecord.name: 1873-1950, 4 cubic feet, 13 scrapbooks (microfilmed).
researchRecord.description: Collection contains statements and addresses made during time as mayor of Kansas City, Missouri, correspondence, financial statements, and legal cases, and 13 scrapbooks that have been microfilmed.
